body_html:
I think he is suggesting you build libtensorflow.so (which you can build via bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so) and then link that to your desktop application.

Once you've built the library, you no longer need involve bazel if you don't want to use it with your desktop application.
body_text:
I think he is suggesting you build libtensorflow.so (which you can build via bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so)  and then link that to your desktop application.
Once you've built the library, you no longer need involve bazel if you don't want to use it with your desktop application.
body:
I think he is suggesting you build `libtensorflow.so` (which you can build via `bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so`)  and then link that to your desktop application.

Once you've built the library, you no longer need involve bazel if you don't want to use it with your desktop application.
